page.title: 13OLD TRANSPORT ROUTES
page.content: The study area is traversed by two old transport routes, now disused. A dismantled railway runs from Botley, S.W. of the area, to Bishop's Waltham just N.W. of the area. The line has been the subject of study by the Botley Historical Society and owes its origin to the strawberry industry in the area. It has been nicknamed the "Strawberry Line" and trainloads used to carry the fruit up to London for sale at Covent Garden. At the time of this study, the course of the railway was still clearly visible and in fact provided a very attractive walk. It has scope for public use as a footpath. The Roman Road marked on the map linked Portchester and Winchester. Virtually nothing is visible on the landscape today except for a few field boundaries.
